p.title: P
p.description: Ray base point as 2 (x, y) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Ray direction vector as 2 (x, y) values.

p.title: P
p.description: Line segment base point as 2 (x, y) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Line segment direction vector as 2 (x, y) values.

LineSegment2D.title: LineSegment2D
LineSegment2D.description: A single line segment face in 2D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the the vertices of the polyline. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

interpolated.title: Interpolated
interpolated.description: A boolean to note whether the polyline should be interpolated between the input vertices when it is translated to other interfaces.

c.title: C
c.description: Center of the arc as 2 (x, y) values.

r.title: R
r.description: A number representing the radius of the arc.

a1.title: A1
a1.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the start angle of the arc.

a2.title: A2
a2.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the end angle of the arc.

Arc2D.title: Arc2D
Arc2D.description: A single arc or circle in 2D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the polygon. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

a.title: A
a.description: Value for the alpha channel, which defines the opacity as a number between 0 (fully transparent) and 255 (fully opaque).

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the mesh. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

faces.title: Faces
faces.description: A list of lists with each sub-list having either 3 or 4 integers. These integers correspond to indices within the list of vertices.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: An optional list of colors that correspond to either the faces of the mesh or the vertices of the mesh.

p.title: P
p.description: Ray base point as 3 (x, y, z) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Ray direction vector as 3 (x, y, z) values.

n.title: N
n.description: Plane normal as 3 (x, y, z) values.

o.title: O
o.description: Plane origin as 3 (x, y, z) values

x.title: X
x.description: Plane x-axis as 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it is autocalculated.

p.title: P
p.description: Line segment base point as 3 (x, y, z) values.

v.title: V
v.description: Line segment direction vector as 3 (x, y, z) values.

LineSegment3D.title: LineSegment3D
LineSegment3D.description: A single line segment face in 3D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the the vertices of the polyline. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

interpolated.title: Interpolated
interpolated.description: A boolean to note whether the polyline should be interpolated between the input vertices when it is translated to other interfaces.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: A Plane in which the arc lies with an origin representing the center of the circle for the arc.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: A number representing the radius of the arc.

a1.title: A1
a1.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the start angle of the arc.

a2.title: A2
a2.description: A number between 0 and 2 * pi for the end angle of the arc.

Arc3D.title: Arc3D
Arc3D.description: A single arc or circle in 3D space.

boundary.title: Boundary
boundary.description: A list of points representing the outer boundary vertices of the face. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

holes.title: Holes
holes.description: Optional list of lists with one list for each hole in the face.Each hole should be a list of at least 3 points and each point a list of 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it will be assumed that there are no holes in the face.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: Optional Plane indicating the plane in which the face exists.If None, the plane will usually be derived from the boundary points.

Face3D.title: Face3D
Face3D.description: A single planar face in 3D space.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the mesh. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

faces.title: Faces
faces.description: A list of lists with each sub-list having either 3 or 4 integers. These integers correspond to indices within the list of vertices.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: An optional list of colors that correspond to either the faces of the mesh or the vertices of the mesh.

edge_indices.title: Edge Indices
edge_indices.description: An array objects that each contain two integers. These integers correspond to indices within the vertices list and each tuple represents a line segment for an edge of the polyface.

edge_types.title: Edge Types
edge_types.description: An array of integers for each edge that parallels the edge_indices list. An integer of 0 denotes a naked edge, an integer of 1 denotes an internal edge. Anything higher is a non-manifold edge.

vertices.title: Vertices
vertices.description: A list of points representing the vertices of the polyface. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

face_indices.title: Face Indices
face_indices.description: A list of lists with one list for each face of the polyface. Each face list must contain at least one sub-list of integers corresponding to indices within the vertices list. Additional sub-lists of integers may follow this one such that the first sub-list denotes the boundary of the face while each subsequent sub-list denotes a hole in the face.

edge_information.title: Edge Information
edge_information.description: Optional edge information, which will speed up the creation of the Polyface object if it is available but should be left as None if it is unknown. If None, edge_information will be computed from the vertices and face_indices inputs.

center.title: Center
center.description: The center of the sphere as 3 (x, y, z) values.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: A number representing the radius of the sphere.

vertex.title: Vertex
vertex.description: The point at the tip of the cone as 3 (x, y, z) values.

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: The vector representing the direction of the cone as 3 (x, y, z) values. The vector extends from the vertex to the center of the base.

angle.title: Angle
angle.description: An angle in radians representing the half angle between the axis and the surface.

center.title: Center
center.description: The center of the bottom base of the cylinder as 3 (x, y, z) values.

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: The vector representing the direction of the cylinder as 3 (x, y, z) values. The vector extends from the bottom base center to the top base center.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: A number representing the radius of the cylinder.

Default.title: Default
Default.description: Object to signify when the default value of a visual interface should be used.

base_plane.title: Base Plane
base_plane.description: A Ladybug Plane object to note the starting position from where the legend will be generated. The default is the world XY plane at origin (0, 0, 0) unless the legend is assigned to a specific geometry, in which case the origin is in the lower right corner of the geometry bounding box for vertical legends and the upper right corner for horizontal legends.

segment_height.title: Segment Height
segment_height.description: A number to set the height for each of the legend segments. The default is 1 unless the legend is assigned to a specific geometry, in which case it is automatically set to a value on an appropriate scale (some fraction of the bounding box around the geometry).

segment_width.title: Segment Width
segment_width.description: A number to set the width for each of the legend segments. The default is 1 unless the legend is assigned to a specific geometry, in which case it is automatically set to a value on an appropriate scale (some fraction of the bounding box around the geometry).

text_height.title: Text Height
text_height.description: A number to set the height for the legend text. Default is 1/3 of the segment_height.

Legend3DParameters.title: Legend3DParameters
Legend3DParameters.description: Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

origin_x.title: Origin X
origin_x.description: A text string to note the X coordinate of the base point from where the legend will be generated (assuming an origin in the upper-left corner of the viewport with higher positive values of X moving to the right). Text must be formatted as an integer followed by either "px" (to denote the number of viewport pixels) or "%" (to denote the percentage of the viewport width). Examples include 10px, 5%. The default is set to make the legend clearly visible on the viewport (usually 10px).

origin_y.title: Origin Y
origin_y.description: A text string to note the Y coordinate of the base point from where the legend will be generated (assuming an origin in the upper-left corner of the viewport with higher positive values of Y moving downward). Text must be formatted as an integer followed by either "px" (to denote the number of viewport pixels) or "%" (to denote the percentage of the viewport height). Examples include 10px, 5%. The default is set to make the legend clearly visible on the viewport (usually 50px).

segment_height.title: Segment Height
segment_height.description: A text string to note the height for each of the legend segments. Text must be formatted as an integer followed by either "px" (to denote the number of viewport pixels) or "%" (to denote the percentage of the viewport height). Examples include 10px, 5%. The default is set to make most legends readable (25px for horizontal legends and 36px for vertical legends).

segment_width.title: Segment Width
segment_width.description: A text string to set the width for each of the legend segments. Text must be formatted as an integer followed by either "px" (to denote the number of viewport pixels) or "%" (to denote the percentage of the viewport width). Examples include 10px, 5%. The default is set to make most legends readable (36px for horizontal legends and 25px for vertical legends).

text_height.title: Text Height
text_height.description: A text string to set the height for the legend text. Text must be formatted as an integer followed by either "px" (to denote the number of viewport pixels) or "%" (to denote the percentage of the viewport height). Examples include 10px, 5%. Default is 1/3 of the segment_height. Default is 12px.

Legend2DParameters.title: Legend2DParameters
Legend2DParameters.description: Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

min.title: Min
min.description: A number to set the lower boundary of the legend. If Default, the minimum of the values associated with the legend will be used.

max.title: Max
max.description: A number to set the upper boundary of the legend. If Default, the maximum of the values associated with the legend will be used.

segment_count.title: Segment Count
segment_count.description: An integer representing the number of steps between the high and low boundary of the legend. The default is set to 11 or it will be equal to the number of items in the ordinal_dictionary. Any custom values input in here should always be greater than or equal to 2.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: An list of color objects. Default is the Ladybug original colorset.

title.title: Title
title.description: Text string for Legend title. Typically, the units of the data are used here but the type of data might also be used.

continuous_legend.title: Continuous Legend
continuous_legend.description: Boolean noting whether legend is drawn as a gradient or discrete segments.

ordinal_dictionary.title: Ordinal Dictionary
ordinal_dictionary.description: Optional dictionary that maps values to text categories. If None, numerical values will be used for the legend segments. If not, text categories will be used and the legend will be ordinal. Note that, if the number of items in the dictionary are less than the segment_count, some segments will not receive any label. Examples for possible dictionaries include: {-1: "Cold", 0: "Neutral", 1: "Hot"}, {0: "False", 1: "True"}

decimal_count.title: Decimal Count
decimal_count.description: An an integer for the number of decimal places in the legend text. Note that this input has no bearing on the resulting legend text when an ordinal_dictionary is present.

include_larger_smaller.title: Include Larger Smaller
include_larger_smaller.description: Boolean noting whether > and < should be included in legend segment text.

vertical.title: Vertical
vertical.description: Boolean noting whether legend is vertical (True) or horizontal (False).

font.title: Font
font.description: Text string to set the font for the legend text. Examples include "Arial", "Times New Roman", "Courier". Note that this parameter may not have an effect on certain interfaces that have limited access to fonts.

properties_3d.title: Properties 3D
properties_3d.description: A Legend3DParameters object to specify the dimensional properties of the legend when it is rendered in the 3D environment of the geometry scene.

properties_2d.title: Properties 2D
properties_2d.description: A Legend2DParameters object to specify the dimensional properties of the legend when it is rendered in the 2D plane of a screen.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

LegendParameters.title: LegendParameters
LegendParameters.description: Legend parameters used to customize legends.

data_type.description: Text to indicate the type of data. This governs the behavior of the data type and the acceptable units. The DataTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

name.title: Name
name.description: Text to indicate how the data type displays. This can be more specific than the data_type.

name.title: Name
name.description: Text to indicate how the data type displays. This can be more specific than the data_type.

base_unit.title: Base Unit
base_unit.description: Text string for the base unit of the data type, which should be standard SI units where possible.

min.title: Min
min.description: Optional lower limit for the data type, values below which should be physically or mathematically impossible. (Default: -inf)

max.title: Max
max.description: Optional upper limit for the data type, values above which should be physically or mathematically impossible. (Default: +inf)

abbreviation.title: Abbreviation
abbreviation.description: An optional abbreviation for the data type as text.

unit_descr.title: Unit Descr
unit_descr.description: An optional dictionary describing categories that the numerical values of the units relate to. For example: {-1: "Cold", 0: "Neutral", +1: "Hot"}; {0: "False", 1: "True"}.

point_in_time.title: Point In Time
point_in_time.description: Boolean to note whether the data type represents conditions at a single instant in time (True) as opposed to being an average or accumulation over time (False) when it is found in hourly lists of data.

cumulative.title: Cumulative
cumulative.description: Boolean to tell whether the data type can be cumulative when it is represented over time (True) or it can only be averaged over time to be meaningful (False). Note that cumulative cannot be True when point_in_time is also True.

values.title: Values
values.description: A list of numerical values that will be used to generate the visualization colors.

legend_parameters.title: Legend Parameters
legend_parameters.description: An Optional LegendParameters object to override default parameters of the legend. None indicates that default legend parameters will be used.

data_type.title: Data Type
data_type.description: Optional DataType from the ladybug datatype subpackage (ie. Temperature()) , which will be used to assign default legend properties. If None, the legend associated with this object will contain no units unless a unit below is specified.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: Optional text string for the units of the values. (ie. "C"). If None, the default units of the data_type will be used.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

VisualizationData.title: VisualizationData
VisualizationData.description: Represents a data set for visualization with legend parameters and data type.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: A list of ladybug-geometry objects that is aligned with the values in the input data_sets. The length of this list should usually be equal to the total number of values in each data_set, indicating that each geometry gets a single color. Alternatively, if all of the geometry objects are meshes, the number of values in the data can be equal to the total number of faces across the meshes or the total number of vertices across the meshes.

data_sets.title: Data Sets
data_sets.description: An list of VisualizationData objects representing the data sets that are associated with the input geometry.

active_data.title: Active Data
active_data.description: An integer to denote which of the input data_sets should be displayed by default.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

AnalysisGeometry.title: AnalysisGeometry
AnalysisGeometry.description: An object where multiple data streams correspond to the same geometry.

DisplayVector2D.title: DisplayVector2D
DisplayVector2D.description: A point object in 2D space with display properties.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: Number for the radius with which the point should be displayed in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print).

DisplayPoint2D.title: DisplayPoint2D
DisplayPoint2D.description: A point object in 2D space with display properties.

DisplayRay2D.title: DisplayRay2D
DisplayRay2D.description: A ray object in 2D space with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayLineSegment2D.title: DisplayLineSegment2D
DisplayLineSegment2D.description: A single line segment face in 2D space with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayPolyline2D.title: DisplayPolyline2D
DisplayPolyline2D.description: A polyline in 2D space with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayArc2D.title: DisplayArc2D
DisplayArc2D.description: A single arc or circle in 2D space with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayPolygon2D.title: DisplayPolygon2D
DisplayPolygon2D.description: A single polygon in 2D space with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayMesh2D.title: DisplayMesh2D
DisplayMesh2D.description: A mesh in 2D space with display properties.

DisplayVector3D.title: DisplayVector3D
DisplayVector3D.description: A point object in 3D space with display properties.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: Number for the radius with which the point should be displayed in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print).

DisplayPoint3D.title: DisplayPoint3D
DisplayPoint3D.description: A point object in 3D space with display properties.

DisplayRay3D.title: DisplayRay3D
DisplayRay3D.description: A ray object in 3D space with display properties.

show_axes.title: Show Axes
show_axes.description: A boolean to note whether the plane should be displayed with XY axes instead of just an origin point and a normal vector.

show_grid.title: Show Grid
show_grid.description: A boolean to note whether the plane should be displayed with a grid.

DisplayPlane.title: DisplayPlane
DisplayPlane.description: A plane object with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayLineSegment3D.title: DisplayLineSegment3D
DisplayLineSegment3D.description: A single line segment face in 3D space with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayPolyline3D.title: DisplayPolyline3D
DisplayPolyline3D.description: A polyline in 3D space with display properties.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayArc3D.title: DisplayArc3D
DisplayArc3D.description: A single arc or circle in 3D space with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayFace3D.title: DisplayFace3D
DisplayFace3D.description: A single planar face in 3D space with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayMesh3D.title: DisplayMesh3D
DisplayMesh3D.description: A mesh in 3D space with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayPolyface3D.title: DisplayPolyface3D
DisplayPolyface3D.description: A Polyface in 3D space with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplaySphere.title: DisplaySphere
DisplaySphere.description: A sphere object with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayCone.title: DisplayCone
DisplayCone.description: A cone object with display properties.

display_mode.description: Text to indicate the display mode (surface, wireframe, etc.). The DisplayModes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

DisplayCylinder.title: DisplayCylinder
DisplayCylinder.description: A cylinder object with display properties.

text.title: Text
text.description: A text string to be displayed in the 3D scene.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: A ladybug-geometry Plane object to locate and orient the text in the 3D scene.

height.title: Height
height.description: A number for the height of the text in the 3D scene.

font.title: Font
font.description: A text string for the font in which to draw the text. Note that this field may not be interpreted the same on all machines and in all interfaces, particularly when a machine lacks a given font.

horizontal_alignment.description: String to specify the horizontal alignment of the text.

vertical_alignment.description: String to specify the vertical alignment of the text.

DisplayText3D.title: DisplayText3D
DisplayText3D.description: A text object in 3D space with display properties.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: A list of ladybug-geometry or ladybug-display objects that gives context to analysis geometry or other aspects of the visualization. Typically, these will display in wireframe around the geometry, though the properties of display geometry can be used to customize the visualization.

ContextGeometry.title: ContextGeometry
ContextGeometry.description: An object representing context geometry to display.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: A list of AnalysisGeometry and ContextGeometry objects to display in the visualization. Each geometry object will typically be translated to its own layer within the interface that renders the VisualizationSet.

VisualizationSet.title: VisualizationSet
VisualizationSet.description: A visualization set containing analysis and context geometry to be visualized.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Text string for a unique object ID. Must be less than 100 characters and not contain spaces or special characters.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: Display name of the object with no character restrictions. This is typically used to set the layer of the object in the interface that renders the VisualizationSet. A :: in the display_name can be used to denote sub-layers following a convention of ParentLayer::SubLayer. If not set, the display_name will be equal to the object identifier.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

SingleColorBase.title: SingleColorBase
SingleColorBase.description: Base class for all Geometric Display objects with a single color.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

DisplayBaseModel.title: DisplayBaseModel
DisplayBaseModel.description: Base class for all Geometric Display objects.

line_width.title: Line Width
line_width.description: Number for line width in pixels (for the screen) or millimeters (in print). Set to zero to hide the geometry.

line_type.description: Text to indicate the type of line to display (dashed, dotted, etc.). The LineTypes enumeration contains all acceptable types.

LineCurveBase.title: LineCurveBase
LineCurveBase.description: Base class for all Geometric Display objects with a line like properties.

type.title: Type
type.description: A base class to use when there is no baseclass available to fall on.
